content: dia de los muertos crochet flower crown by ruth hinman remember your loved ones and celebrate their journey with this beautiful crown made with vibrant fluffy roses marigolds and delicate little blue forget-me-nots that adorn this gorgeous headband and surround two gaily decorated sugar skulls dia de los muertos flower crown materials fair isle liberty craft can - day of the dead 5 5mm crochet hook 3mm crochet hook for skulls only black embroidery floss or crochet thread for skulls only tapestry or yarn needle scissors stitch marker gauge 24 row or16 stitches = 4 finished size 18 headband base with 10 ties on both sides recommendations each stitch forms a v when working in the round a stitch marker is very useful and this small skull is much easier if you can mark the beginning of each row planning your overall look helps to choose which flowers and colors you will use and how many you will need i sketched my crown planned ahead and still had a couple of extra blossoms for my next crown abbreviations ● single_crochet = single_crochet ● half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet ● double_crochet = double_crochet flo or front loop only means leaving ● tc = treble or triple crochet the back part of the v behind ● magic_ring = magic_ring ● increase = increase ● decrease = decrease ● blo = back loop only ● flo = front loop only ● f/o = finish off ● chain = chain ● skip = skip # of stitches indicated ● slip_stitch = slip_stitch ● # = number of stitches in the round blo uses the loops left after the flo fairisleyarn com page | 2 dia de los muertos flower crown notes back loop and front loop only stitches are used to build bulk that stacks or bunches up for a fuller marigold see samples on previous page you can use more or less of any of the flowers and arrange them how you like i made the flowers and then arranged them like a floral arrangement dia de los muertos crown make the headband and all the flowers and skulls and decorate your skulls before you begin assembly headband base fair isle liberty - black row 1 chain 60 and slip_stitch into the first chain chain 60 and use stitch marker to mark the place chain 60 and slip_stitch into the chain with your stitch marker chain 1 this counts as your first single_crochet and 4 single_crochet 5 half_double_crochet 10 double_crochet 20 tc 10 double_crochet 5 half_double_crochet 5 single_crochet 60 chain 1 and turn row 2 chain 1 counts as first stitch of this row 59 single_crochet 60 chain 1 and turn row 3 chain 1 counts as first stitch of this row 4 single_crochet 5 half_double_crochet 10 double_crochet 20 tc 10 double_crochet 5 half_double_crochet 5 single_crochet and f/o and sew in your ends the right side of the headband is the side you ended on skull use 3mm crochet hook for the skulls only you
